item.title: MJD returns & training camp storylines
item.itunes:title: MJD returns & training camp storylines
item.description:
Dave Dameshek is joined in Studio 66 by our old pal Maurice Jones-Drew, who makes his return after taking the summer off. After catching up with MJD about his vacation, Shek asks how confident Maurice is in his Rams to make the Super Bowl after their recent off-season additions (3:30). Next, MJD makes the bold claim the Cleveland Browns will make the playoffs en route to a 10 win season since their roster has been much improved (11:50). Shek then explains why he's not a fan of the Jets welcoming back Darrelle Revis to sign a one day contract after he left them for the arch-rival New England Patriots (25:20). Unfortunately for Chicago Bears fans, Shek adds them to the list of teams who will not be making the playoffs in 2018 with MJD agreeing that they are the last place team in the NFC North (33:10). Lastly, the guys wrap up the show with who are the best newcomers in the NFC West (40:55)?

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: Antonio Brown and Willie McGinest
item.itunes:title: Antonio Brown and Willie McGinest
item.description:
Dave Dameshek is joined in Studio 66 by Cleveland Browns legend Willie McGinest, who is now a member of the virtual Wall of Fame. Shek asks Willie who is the New England Patriots Jenga piece (6:50) and what he thinks of Danny Amendola's comments on Bill Belichick being like a school principal (9:15)? Willie also picks which team is better - the 2017 or the 2018 New England Patriots (16:30). Next, Antonio Brown who will be on the Madden 19 cover joins the DDFP (22:46). Shek and Antonio kibitz about the Le'Veon Bell contract situation (31:05), who the Steelers Jenga piece is and his thoughts on potentially being the greatest wide receiver of all-time (25:30). Shek ends the notion that Antonio isn't QB-proof (38:38) and totally misses A.B.'s handshake at the end (39:30).

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: AFC Jenga pieces
item.itunes:title: AFC Jenga pieces
item.description:
Dave Dameshek is joined in Studio 66 by co-host of the Move The Sticks podcast, Bucky Brooks after Shek made an appearance of his own on MTS. Shek and Bucky kibitzed about who was the most exciting running back to ever watch (3:10) and Steelers running back Le'Veon Bell's contract situation (5:05). The guys also stay on the topic of the Steelers by questioning if they should've drafted another running back and if this current group of star players can stay together (11:20). Next, Shek and Bucky spend the rest of the show deciding who is each of the AFC teams Jenga pieces (15:20).

item.itunes:title: Best Additions to the AFC West & World Cup Reaction
item.description:
Dave Dameshek is joined by Handsome Hank and Matt "Money" Smith to discuss Handsome's reaction to England losing in the World Cup semi-finals (2:06) and determine which non-soccer-playing U.S. athletes would likely be dominant on the United States Men's National Team (32:32). The fellas also discuss which sporting events in history have been able to unite Americans the most (5:04). Then, the guys go through the AFC West, naming the most important newcomers for every team (41:40). Plus, the guys react to yet another memorable voicemail left by producer Kent Brown's mom (35:12).

item.title: DDFP 682: Are the Seahawks playoff bound & LeBron to LA
item.itunes:title: DDFP 682: Are the Seahawks playoff bound & LeBron to LA
item.description:
Dave Dameshek is joined in Studio 66 by Matt "Money" Smith who is back from his vacation. Money chats about his trip to Idaho where he golfed on one of the best courses in America (5:00). With the big news that LeBron James signed with the Los Angeles Lakers, Shek and Money kibitz about his impact on the city and how far can the Lakers go especially now that the Golden State Warriors added DeMarcus Cousins (9:40). After the NBA discussion, Shek adds the Seattle Seahawks to the list of teams who will not make the 2018 NFL playoffs (49:55). The gang wraps up the show with Money reading some of Eddie Spaghetti's tweets (1:07:20).

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

With the big news that LeBron James signed with the Los Angeles Lakers, Shek and Money kibitz about his impact on the city and how far can the Lakers go especially now that the Golden State Warriors added DeMarcus Cousins (9:40). After the NBA discussion, Shek adds the Seattle Seahawks to the list of teams who will not make the 2018 NFL playoffs (49:55). The gang wraps up the show with Money reading some of Eddie Spaghetti's tweets (1:07:20).
item.itunes:author: NFL

item.title: DDFP 681: NFL player swap & should you play board games in public?
item.itunes:title: DDFP 681: NFL player swap & should you play board games in public?
item.description:
Dave Dameshek is joined in Studio 66 by NFL Network colleague Martin Weiss and Eddie Spaghetti as he makes the jump from behind the glass. Martin asks the group if the Steelers trio of Ben Roethlisberger, Antonio Brown and Le'Veon Bell each swapped teams with Aaron Rodgers, DeAndre Hopkins and Todd Gurley II how much would their NFL careers be different (14:00)? Next, Shek makes fun of Spaghetti for attending awful movies like Dan In Real Life with a large group of his male friends, which poses the question do people actually walk out of movies (35:40)? Then, Spaghetti and EmmaVP explain how they're both very anti playing board games, such as Jenga or Connect Four, at bars (46:15). Lastly, Martin tells the group he just came back from a vacation in Cabo that he went on alone (54:25).

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

item.title: DDFP 680: Reggie Wayne & James Jones
item.itunes:title: DDFP 680: Reggie Wayne & James Jones
item.description:
Dave Dameshek is joined in Studio 66 by former NFL wide receivers Reggie Wayne and James Jones to help Shek complete a few lists. The first ranking they get to is who's the greatest running back ever, to which James and Reggie both say Barry Sanders (3:30). Tony Romo said the Packers are the team to beat in 2018 so the gang debates if this statement will hold up (9:45). The next list the guys get to is Win, Place, Show - best quarterbacks of the last quarter century (20:00). Since Antonio Brown is having a Hall of Fame career, the last list Shek, James and Reggie create are their top five wide receivers of all-time (38:50).

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

item.title: DDFP 679: Best celebrity encounters & Colts playoff chances
item.itunes:title: DDFP 679: Best celebrity encounters & Colts playoff chances
item.description:
Dave Dameshek is joined in Studio 66 by Cole Wright and Handsome Hank, who is now an uncle to the greatly named newborn "Ferris" (4:40). The guys kibitz about their NFL Media Summit in Santa Monica including run-ins with Arnold Schwarzenegger and Barry Bonds (15:50). This leads into the topic of best celebrity encounters the DDFP group has had including Ralphie from A Christmas Story, Jack Hamm, Michael Showalter, Eddie Vedder and Hank's long plane ride with Laura Dern (19:15). Shek then brings up a conversation he had with Al Riveron about new rule changes in the upcoming NFL season (30:00). Next, Shek adds the Indianapolis Colts to the list of teams that will not make the playoffs in the 2018 season. Lastly, Shek defeats Handsome Hank in a game of 'Use Your Noodle' by listing more correct starting QB's from the 2017 season (46:40).

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

item.title: DDFP 678: Patriots drama & Will Lamar Jackson start the season?
item.itunes:title: DDFP 678: Patriots drama & Will Lamar Jackson start the season?
item.description:
Dave Dameshek is joined in Studio 66 by Handsome Hank and Cleveland Browns legend Willie McGinest. The group starts to kibitz about Malcolm Butler's absence from Super Bowl LII and if he was playing would the Patriots have won another ring (6:40)? While on the topic of the New England Patriots, Shek asks Willie about Tom Brady's mindset going into this season with some potential issues with his coach Bill Belichick (9:30). Next, Shek brings up the quarterback finger bet and asks Willie for his opinion if Lamar Jackson will be starting for the Baltimore Ravens (23:00)? Then Willie told some stories from his playing days such as Rodney Harrison torpedoing him in the back or what kind of trash talk went on at the bottom of the pile (38:00). Finally the show wraps up with Shek asking Willie who would you rather have for the next two seasons - Tom Brady or Jimmy Garoppolo (55:20)?

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

item.title: DDFP 677: Los Angeles Rams mini-camp
item.itunes:title: DDFP 677: Los Angeles Rams mini-camp
item.description:
Dave Dameshek and the rest of the DDFP crew head to Thousand Oaks, California to stop by the Los Angeles Rams training facility! First, Shek sits down with newly acquired wide receiver, Brandin Cooks, to chat about his cooking expertise (or lack thereof), what his touchdown call should sound like and how much he knows about Jared Goff (3:04). Next, another Rams newcomer, Aqib Talib, stops by to talk about how Goff compares to Peyton Manning and Tom Brady, where Aaron Donald ranks among the best defensive players and if Shek can help him find a home in Los Angeles (13:04). Lastly, potential Sheky winner for best football playing guest, Johnny Hekker, sits down with Shek to kibitz about being a new dad, if he will finally punt barefoot and if the curse of "s'posta" will affect the team (22:52).

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: DDFP 676: Ross Tucker & is missing mini camp a big deal?
item.itunes:title: DDFP 676: Ross Tucker & is missing mini camp a big deal?
item.description:
Dave Dameshek is joined in Studio 66 by former NFL offensive lineman & podcast host Ross Tucker as well as Matt "Money" Smith and Handsome Hank. The gang starts up by talking about if LeBron James will end up in Los Angeles as well as Kobe Bryant's recent comments about LeBron (4:23). Since it is the anniversary of the Michael Jordan flu game, the group told stories of their own flu game moments including Ross playing a game in Osaka, Japan (15:50). Next, Shek asks the group if it's important that so many players this off-season such as Tom Brady and Julio Jones are missing mandatory mini-camps (39:40). Lastly, David Carr pops into the studio to defend having a key card to the Raiders facility and Ross comments about his handsomeness (59:55).

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: DDFP 675: The Bald Bryan Summer movie edition!
item.itunes:title: DDFP 675: The Bald Bryan Summer movie edition!
item.description:
Dave Dameshek is joined in Studio 66 by Bald Bryan to talk all things movies! The DDFP group starts out by listing their favorite football movies (5:30) and then things that happen in movies but don't ever occur in real life (13:50). Next, Shek asks Bald Bryan if he has any party scenes from movies to add to your best movie parties list (23:55). Shek and Bald Bryan review Solo, then re-rank the best Star Wars films in order (29:15). Finally, Bald Bryan gives us a brand new list of actor redundancies in movies (41:20).

item.title: DDFP 674: Best NFL dynasty & best music memories!
item.itunes:title: DDFP 674: Best NFL dynasty & best music memories!
item.description:
Dave Dameshek is joined in Studio 66 by Matt "Money" Smith and Cole Wright who quickly has to defend his Smashing Pumpkins t shirt which leads to an in depth music discussion about some of their best music memories (3:40). The group then makes fun of an Eddie Spaghetti Tweet about National Donut Day, which then becomes a debate about which kind of donut is best (21:07)? The guys finally get to football as Shek wants to expand on his 'best dynasty' question and asks which is the best NFL dynasty (27:40)? Next, we welcome in new intern Cameron with a DDFP quiz (51:05). Finally, the show wraps up debating Dak Prescott's comments about if you actually need a true #1 wide receiver in the NFL (55:45) to succeed?

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

item.itunes:title: DDFP 673: Johnny Knoxville, Reggie Wayne & David Carr
item.description:
Dave Dameshek is first joined in Studio 66 by NFL Network analysts Reggie Wayne and David Carr (1:10). The group discusses David's key card access with the Raiders (3:05), Peyton Manning vs Andrew Luck in the huddle (5:50) and Reggie's two week stint with the New England Patriots (10:25). The guys also agree to a future bet of who can throw a football and a baseball the hardest vs Cole Wright (19:45). Next, the star and writer of Action Point, Johnny Knoxville comes to the studio to kibitz about his new movie (21:27). Johnny talks about the various injuries he suffered on set (24:00), who the most handsome Jackass member is (30:10) and who are some of the coolest people he knows (26:40).

item.title: DDFP 672: Cliff Avril & which team is the greatest dynasty ever?
item.itunes:title: DDFP 672: Cliff Avril & which team is the greatest dynasty ever?
item.description:
Dave Dameshek is joined in Studio 66 by Handsome Hank and Cole Wright to discuss Cliff Avril's strong comments on Pete Carroll. Avril, while in Studio 66 said Carroll lost the team after losing Super Bowl XLIX, so the group debates if they would have went on to become a dynasty if they won that game (11:15). While on the topic of dynasties, Shek, Cole and Handsome discuss if the Golden State Warriors defeat the Cleveland Cavaliers again do they become sports' greatest dynasty (19:25)? Next, we hear from the former Seahawk Cliff Avril, after stopping by the DDFP HQ (24:35). Before the show ended the gang also touched on the coolest concerts they've been to (5:45), a voicemail from Kent Brown's mom on Cal Ripken Jr. (49:20) and who on the DDFP goes around their home in the nude the most (52:00)?

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: DDFP 671: Dave & DeMarcus Do Dallas
item.itunes:title: DDFP 671: Dave & DeMarcus Do Dallas
item.description:
Dave Dameshek sits down with Dallas Cowboys DE DeMarcus Lawrence at Nick & Sam's restaurant in Dallas, Texas to discuss all things Cowboys over a huge tomahawk steak dinner. The guys talk about DeMarcus' in-season eating regimen (23:09) and his hobbies outside of football (22:32). Then, in a game of "Four vs. Nine," Shek gives DeMarcus various everyday life scenarios where DeMarcus must choose between his two QBs, Dak Prescott and Tony Romo (14:12). Also, Lawrence details the Cowboys' successful run in 2016 and the guys discuss whether or not they would've made a real Super Bowl push if Tony Romo were under center (16:30). Plus, DeMarcus gives his teammates Zeke Elliott and Dak Prescott new nicknames (10:21)!

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: DDFP 670: Vikings' NFC North chances & Is Ryan Tannehill good?
item.itunes:title: DDFP 670: Vikings' NFC North chances & Is Ryan Tannehill good?
item.description:
Dave Dameshek is joined by Handsome Hank and Matt "Money" Smith to discuss whether or not the Chargers should be considered the favorites in the AFC West (6:49) and if the Chiefs have the worst defense in the division (8:47). Also, in honor of "Solo" coming out this week, the fellas talk about which iconic movie characters they wish had their own spin-off (21:08). Then, the guys discuss the Las Vegas Golden Knights' immediate success and determine if fans of a franchise should have to suffer before achieving glory (32:54). Lastly, the guys talk about Dalvin Cook's potential next season and if the Minnesota Vikings should be considered the NFC North favorites (43:30).

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

item.title: DDFP 669: Will Blackmon & ranking the top 5 WR in the NFL
item.itunes:title: DDFP 669: Will Blackmon & ranking the top 5 WR in the NFL
item.description:
Dave Dameshek is joined in Studio 66 by former NFL defensive back Will Blackmon and NFL Network analyst Michael Fabiano. First, Fabs defends himself for posting a picture of his girlfriend on social media claiming he has outkicked his coverage (3:00). Since Will has covered many receivers, Shek asks the question - who are the top five wideouts in the NFL right now (11:00)? Next, Handsome Hank calls in from the NFL offices in Toronto to give some insight for the upcoming Royal Wedding (47:00). Handsome Hank also weighs in on Fabiano's social media usage with Eddie Spaghetti coming to Fab's defense (56:00).

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

item.title: DDFP 668: Will Brinson & the hugging incident gets resolved
item.itunes:title: DDFP 668: Will Brinson & the hugging incident gets resolved
item.description:
Dave Dameshek is joined in Studio 66 by Matt "Money" Smith and CBS Sports' Will Brinson via Skype. Producer Kent Brown sent us a new voicemail from his mom as she reviews The Shape of Water (9:00). The group plays a game of 'Use Your Noodle' as Eddie Spaghetti asks them which NFL quarterbacks have thrown for over 30,000 yards and 250 touchdowns (11:00). Next, everyone reacts to Sully's Tweet about Chick-Fil-A and subsequently ranks the best fast food items (21:20). Shek, Money and Will debate which wide receiver they'd take for this upcoming season between Dez Bryant. Larry Fitzgerald, Jordy Nelson, Alshon Jeffery. Adam Thielen, Brandon Marshall or Michael Crabtree (29:50). Lastly, Shek brings up the awkward hug between EmmaVP and Money at the Dodgers game last week and makes them reenact the scene (36:00).

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: DDFP 667: David Carr's first appearance & when is hugging weird?
item.itunes:title: DDFP 667: David Carr's first appearance & when is hugging weird?
item.description:
Dave Dameshek is joined in Studio 66 by Handsome Hank and former NFL QB & current NFL Network analyst David Carr makes his first appearance on the show. Shek continues to stick up for Ben Roethlisberger after the comments he made about Mason Rudolph so he asks David for his opinion on that (4:26) as well as how Jon Gruden will fair as he takes over the Oakland Raiders (34:20). David gives some insight on his brother Derek's off-season and how the offense will be with some new additions (37:00). After a strange encounter at Dodger Stadium between EmmaVP and Matt "Money" Smith, Shek asks Handsome and David if hugging in certain circumstances is weird (52:00)? Lastly, David talks about some of his interesting stories while on the field including a funny moment in the huddle with Martellus Bennett (1:08:20).

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: DDFP 666: Ben Roethlisberger vs Mason Rudolph, teacher appreciation day & summer movies
item.itunes:title: DDFP 666: Ben Roethlisberger vs Mason Rudolph, teacher appreciation day & summer movies
item.description:
In the very scary 666th episode of the DDFP, Dave Dameshek is joined in Studio 66 by Cole Wright to discuss Ben Roethlisberger's comments towards the Steelers for drafting Mason Rudolph in the third round (8:00). Shek has finally seen Avengers: Infinity War so he asks Cole what other summer blockbusters he is interested in (45:00). Lastly, in honor of teacher appreciation day Shek tells a story about how he got his entire elementary school to shut down because of his antics (56:10).

item.title: DDFP 665: Carson Palmer & Michael Vick on the rookie QBs
item.itunes:title: DDFP 665: Carson Palmer & Michael Vick on the rookie QBs
item.description:
Dave Dameshek is first joined by former NFL quarterback Michael Vick who gives his thoughts on the rookie quarterback class and if he agrees with Dave's prediction that Josh Rosen will be the best of the bunch (4:45). Next, Shek pokes fun at NFL Network fantasy analyst Michael Fabiano for posting a picture of his girlfriend on every social media platform since Dave thinks it's humble bragging (7:02). Shek also argues with Eddie Spaghetti that his Rachel McAdams coffee shop story is not mundane but humble bragging just like Fabiano (9:45). Lastly, former NFL quarterback Carson Palmer joins the show (16:23) to kibitz with Shek about who the best USC QB of all-time is (19:20), what he's been doing with his kids during the early stages of retirement (24:05) and his outlook on the Arizona Cardinals without him playing quarterback (31:15).

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: DDFP 664: NFL Draft recap and when will the rookie QBs debut?
item.itunes:title: DDFP 664: NFL Draft recap and when will the rookie QBs debut?
item.description:
Dave Dameshek is back in Studio 66 and is joined by Matt "Money" Smith to recap their trips to Dallas for the 2018 NFL Draft. Shek talks about how Josh Rosen is his favorite quarterback in this draft but Money doesn't seem to think his attitude will translate well in the NFL (9:26). Next, the guys debate if the NFC West with Rosen, Goff, Wilson and Garoppolo is now the best division for quarterbacks (17:30). Shek and Money also give their thoughts on which week each rookie quarterback will make their debut for their new team (21:25). Eddie Spaghetti is relieved the Giants had a phenomenal draft and didn't trade down (31:20). Lastly we were graced with another great voicemail from Kent Brown's mom about the movie The Darkest Hour (47:25).

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: DDFP 663: Good Morning Football Edition
item.itunes:title: DDFP 663: Good Morning Football Edition
item.description:
Dave Dameshek is in Dallas alongside Kay Adams, Kyle Brandt and Nate Burleson of Good Morning Football. The group recapped the first round of the NFL Draft by giving their thoughts on the Cleveland Browns taking Baker Mayfield and if his personality is similar to Josh Rosen (2:50). Dave also makes the GMFB crew give their win, place show of quarterbacks drafted in the first round (10:48). The group does a mock draft of NFL teams - which roster, city, coaching staff, etc they'd want to be a part of (19:45). Producer Erica Tamposi suggests the crew should try playing the 'Whisper Game' where they have to whisper a phrase while the contestants have headphones on (29:00). The group ends the show with a laugh as they try impersonating Randy Moss, Ross Tucker and of course Dave (38:25).

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: DDFP 662: 2018 NFL Draft Special
item.itunes:title: DDFP 662: 2018 NFL Draft Special
item.description:
Dave Dameshek is live from Dallas, Texas interviewing a plethora of first round picks from AT&T Stadium after they were selected. Saquon Barkley (2:37), Sam Darnold (5:22), Bradley Chubb (8:01), Josh Rosen (11:11), Tremaine Edmunds (13:48), Derwin James (16:59), Leighton Vander Esch (21:55), Terrell Edmunds (27:14) and Lamar Jackson (31:15) all stopped by to sit down with Shek. Shek asks all of the draftees numerous questions including the feeling of getting that phone call saying they were drafted, their thoughts on joining a new team and what they will buy with their first paycheck.

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: DDFP 661: Stanford head coach David Shaw, Steve Mariucci & Daniel Jeremiah
item.itunes:title: DDFP 661: Stanford head coach David Shaw, Steve Mariucci & Daniel Jeremiah
item.description:
Dave Dameshek is in Dallas for the 2018 NFL Draft and is first joined by Move The Sticks podcast host Daniel Jeremiah to preview Thursday night (4:19). First, Shek asks DJ which players have the highest bust potential (8:41), DJ then explains why Sam Darnold is a better fit for the Browns and playing in the AFC North than Josh Rosen (10:58). Lastly Shek asks DJ who each of the 32 NFL teams would take first overall if they had the chance (17:07). Next, NFL Network analyst Steve Mariucci and Stanford Cardinal head football coach Dave Shaw join the DDFP (35:42). Shek asks Coach Shaw how he game planned against Josh Rosen and Sam Darnold when his Stanford teams faced UCLA and USC (41:48). The coaches answer would you rather the cerebral game manager or the gunslinger to which Mooch talks about his time with Brett Favre and Steve Young (44:47). Coach Shaw also gives an update on Andrew Luck's status and Mooch says why the NFL needs Andrew Luck (1:01:55).

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: DDFP 660: Schedule Release, Uniform Review & Reggie Bush
item.itunes:title: DDFP 660: Schedule Release, Uniform Review & Reggie Bush
item.description:
Dave Dameshek is joined by Handsome Hank to discuss the intriguing slate of international games this upcoming season, highlighting the Mexico City matchup between the Chiefs and the Rams, as well as the London game between the Eagles and Jaguars (2:18). Also, the fellas review both the Jaguars and Dolphins’ new uniforms (18:40). Then, Shek sits down with former NFL RB and new NFL Network analyst Reggie Bush to recount his most memorable games with the USC Trojans, detailing the famous “Bush Push” play against Notre Dame in 2005 (42:52). Reggie also remembers his NFL Draft day experience as the number two overall pick in 2006 (56:19).

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: DDFP 658: Willie McGinest & Shaun O'Hara
item.itunes:title: DDFP 658: Willie McGinest & Shaun O'Hara
item.description:
Dave Dameshek is joined by NFL Network's own Willie McGinest and Shaun O'Hara who start off the show by sticking up for fellow colleague, James Jones, after Shek's comments about Aaron Rodgers having the worst wide receiver group ever (12:00). Willie tells his 1994 NFL Draft story when he was picked 4th overall by the New England Patriots even though another team was actually with him at his draft party (41:50). Next, Shaun O'Hara gives us his most memorable play, which was the David Tyree helmet catch in Super Bowl XLII (50:35). Before the show ended Shek asked the guys what their favorite cheese is since it is National Grilled Cheese Day (1:03:45).

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.description:

item.title: DDFP 656: Saints DE Cam Jordan & is MJD on Josh Rosen or Jim Mora's side?
item.itunes:title: DDFP 656: Saints DE Cam Jordan & is MJD on Josh Rosen or Jim Mora's side?
item.description:
Dave Dameshek is first joined by Handsome Hank and Maurice Jones-Drew who finally makes his return to Studio 66. MJD talks about his alma mater, UCLA, specifically about the recent controversy between Josh Rosen and his former coach Jim Mora Jr. (15:07). Shek also makes Maurice give his rankings of the top three QBs in this draft and his answer may shock you (28:43). The group then reviews the new Tennessee Titans uniforms much to the dismay of Maurice (44:40). Next, New Orleans Saints defensive end Cam Jordan stops by Studio 66 to tell his 2011 NFL Draft story (1:06:15), talk about his love of Will Ferrell movies (57:51) and describes his emotions after coming back out of the tunnel during the NFC Divisional loss to the Vikings (1:03:08).

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: DDFP 655: The 'Mickstape' Boys & Big Bear Recap
item.itunes:title: DDFP 655: The 'Mickstape' Boys & Big Bear Recap
item.description:
Dave Dameshek is joined by Coley Mick and Tyler from the Barstool Sports Mickstape podcast (13:19) to kibitz about the best and worst holiday treats (50:18), if the current Golden State Warriors team would defeat the 1996 Chicago Bulls (23:33) and their win, place, show of Star Wars movies (34:45). Coley and Tyler also wanted to hear Shek's list of favorite characters from The Simpsons who aren't part of the Simpson family (37:33). Next, Shek wanted to hear Eddie Spaghetti's thoughts on his New York Giants potentially trading Odell Beckham Jr. before the NFL Draft (3:46). Lastly, producers Sully and Erica Tamposi sat down in Studio 66 to recap their trip to Big Bear along with EmmaVP and Spaghetti (1:02:28).

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: DDFP 654: Matt Williamson & the Big Bear controversy verdict
item.itunes:title: DDFP 654: Matt Williamson & the Big Bear controversy verdict
item.description:
Dave Dameshek is joined by former Cleveland Browns scout and creator of WilliamsonFootball.com, Matt Williamson (6:39), to kibitz about which drills at the NFL Combine actually matter to him (9:50), where Saquon Barkley ranks as a prospect for him (21:45) and how every team shapes their offense based on their quarterbacks skill set (15;55). Matt also gives his win, place and show for the quarterback prospects in the 2018 NFL Draft (23:41). Next, Handsome Hank sits down in Studio 66 (31:52) as judge to determine who was the culprit of the Big Bear controversy. Producers Kent Brown and Sully state their case, plus we hear two surprise voicemails (40:15 & 54:55) who each dish out blame.

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: DDFP 653: Leighton Vander Esch, OBJ's future & parties in movies you'd like to attend
item.itunes:title: DDFP 653: Leighton Vander Esch, OBJ's future & parties in movies you'd like to attend
item.description:
Dave Dameshek is joined by Matt "Money" Smith and Handsome Hank to kibitz about Odell Beckham's future in New York and what the Giants draft plans should be (31:03). The crew debates whether or not Shek can run just one mile after Money completed a half marathon for charity (7:47). Handsome Hank did a deep dive into the controversy surrounding the PodSquad's upcoming Big Bear trip (43:50) and the guys gave parties in movies they wish they could attend (55:58). Next, Boise State Broncos LB Leighton Vander Esch sits down in Studio 66 (1:09:13) with Shek to share his weird NFL Combine stories (1:13:15), why he's bad at the coin flip (1:16:32) and he reenacts what he will do on draft day when he's selected (1:18:55).

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: DDFP 652: 'Scorpion' showrunner Nick Santora
item.itunes:title: DDFP 652: 'Scorpion' showrunner Nick Santora
item.description:
The DDFP went on the road to the production office of CBS' Scorpion where Dave Dameshek kibitz's with showrunner, Nick Santora, since Shek will be on a future episode (March 26th 10 PM ET). The two old friends get into Nick's love of the New York Giants & Islanders (25:50) , how he got into writing (52:17) and Shek's acting performance alongside Katharine McPhee (1:05:25). The guys also talk about the legendary Sunday morning football parties at Jimmy Kimmel's house including Tom Cruise showing up and how Shek became friends with Jon Hamm (3:45).

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.itunes:title: DDFP 651: AJ Bouye & HOF QB's with the worst WR group
item.description:
Dave Dameshek is joined by Patrick Claybon to react to the New York Jets trading up for the #3 overall pick (19:30), break down which Hall of Fame quarterbacks have played with the worst wide receivers (12:16) and discuss people that suffer from 'invisible tattoo syndrome' (24:55). Shek also jokingly forces Claybon to debate Michael Jordan vs LeBron James (49:10). Next, Jacksonville Jaguars cornerback AJ Bouye joins the show to kibitz about the Jags beating Shek's Steelers (1:02:10), Blake Bortles bailing out the defense in the playoffs (1:03:35) and old school NBA vs new school (1:09:50).

item.title: DDFP 649: Tyrann Mathieu & free agent frenzy!
item.itunes:title: DDFP 649: Tyrann Mathieu & free agent frenzy!
item.description:
Dave Dameshek is joined by Patrick Claybon to kibitz about the crazy day in the NFL with all the free agent signings. Shek and Claybon go over Kirk Cousins signing in Minnesota (4:40), the end of the Legion of Boom (6:35) and why teams became so desperate to overpay for quarterbacks (11:10). Next, Cardinals safety Tyrann Mathieu sits down (20:13) to tell his 2013 NFL Draft story (29:00) and Shek becomes his off-season trainer to make him tougher (32:00). Lastly, Shek tries to turn Tyrann into a viral gif (35:40)!

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

item.title: DDFP 647: Marquette King and Le'Veon Bell's future
item.itunes:title: DDFP 647: Marquette King and Le'Veon Bell's future
item.description:
Dave Dameshek is joined by Handsome Hank and Dan Hellie who kibitz about the Pittsburgh Steelers using their franchise tag on running back Le'Veon Bell and will he stick with the team long-term (38:57)? The guys react to two voicemails from producer Kent Brown's mom, who gives her thoughts on The Bachelor and The Shape of Water (13:36). Plus, the guys play a game of Use Your Noodle by naming every Super Bowl MVP winner (20:20). Next, Oakland Raiders punter Marquette King joins the show (48:47) and explains to Shek why he won't be punting barefoot or why he no longer laughs at other punters. The pair wrap up the show by making Marquette into a viral gif (1:09:30).

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: DDFP 646: Mo Dameshek & the Handsome Hank incident
item.itunes:title: DDFP 646: Mo Dameshek & the Handsome Hank incident
item.description:
Dave Dameshek is first joined by Patrick Claybon and Handsome Hank to revisit the now infamous "QB Finger Bet" regarding which teams will have a new quarterback in 2018 (33:30), as well as discuss the New York Jets' decision to cut Muhammad Wilkerson (41:20). Then, Hank relives the day he got sick last week after recording the show, detailing exactly what went down when he left the set (1:26). The guys also ask themselves the big questions such as the explanation for leap year (46:00), how we can ultimately fix global warming (47:03) and how the first humans on Earth discovered what food to eat (49:00). Lastly, Shek is visited by his biggest fan, his mother, Mo Dameshek, who plays a game of "Who's More Handsome (55:36)?" She also explains the catch rule (1:01:37) and tells the tale of teenage Shek's run-in with the law (1:14:34).

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.itunes:title: DDFP 643: Reggie Wayne on winning Super Bowl XLI & his 2001 NFL Draft story

Reggie also recounts the biggest play he made in his career, which was in the first quarter Super Bowl XLI vs the Chicago Bears (31:00). item.title: DDFP 638: SB LII Red Challenge Flag Picks & QB finger debate!
item.itunes:title: DDFP 638: SB LII Red Challenge Flag Picks & QB finger debate!
item.description:
Dave Dameshek is joined by Matt "Money" Smith, Cynthia Frelund and Handsome Hank in Minneapolis - just a few days away from Super Bowl LII! The group made fun of Shek for being a quasi-celebrity around Minneapolis as many members of the Shek Republic said hello (4:50). Shek also got on Money's case for enjoying black coffee instead of using milk, cream or sugar (7:30). Next, the quarterback finger bet started up again after the Alex Smith trade, with Shek still pleading that ten or more teams will have a new starter next season or he'll lose a finger (20:00). Lastly, Shek, Money, Cynthia and Handsome made their Red Challenge Flag picks for Super Bowl LII between the Philadelphia Eagles and the New England Patriots (32:33).

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

item.title: DDFP 637: Media Night Recap, SB preview & Alex Smith
item.itunes:title: DDFP 637: Media Night Recap, SB preview & Alex Smith
item.description:
Dave Dameshek is joined by Maurice Jones-Drew to revisit the dramatic AFC Championship matchup between the Jaguars and Patriots (12:48), as well as the end of the Vikings’ dream of hosting a home Super Bowl. The fellas talk about their experiences in Minnesota thus far, highlighting some great exchanges at Media Night and the pros and cons of cold weather cities (5:33). Then, Maurice makes his official pick for Super Bowl LII and the guys debate whether or not the Eagles actually have the upper hand with Chris Long and LeGarrette Blount on their squad this season (45:30). Lastly, Shek sits down with Chiefs QB Alex Smith to talk about where he could end up playing next year, who should win MVP and whether or not teams need an elite QB to win a championship (57:07). 

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.itunes:title: DDFP 636: Willie McGinest, Josh McCown & Tre Boston
item.description:
Dave Dameshek is once again joined by USC Trojans and Cleveland Browns legend Willie McGinest who breaks down the New England Patriots come from behind victory over the Jacksonville Jaguars (3:00) and how teams prepare during the two weeks leading up to big game (36:30). Willie also told Shek about his conversation with Tom Brady after his great performance in the AFC Title game (5:22). Next, New York Jets quarterback Josh McCown kibitzed with Shek about his season with the team and the charitable work he has been doing off the field (45:50). Lastly, Los Angeles Chargers safety Tre Boston sat down with Shek for a few minutes to preview SB LII since he played both the Eagles and Patriots this season (1:00:55).

item.title: DDFP 635: Championship Round Recap & 2018 QB Changes
item.itunes:title: DDFP 635: Championship Round Recap & 2018 QB Changes
item.description:
Dave Dameshek is joined by Colleen Wolfe and Gregg Rosenthal to recap the AFC and NFC Championship games and discuss both of their experiences being in Philadelphia for the Eagles’ victory (14:07). Then, in a wild, “Freaky Sunday” situation, Colleen and Gregg switch fandoms and advocate for the other’s team (18:07). Also, Gregg and Colleen weigh in on Shek’s prediction regarding the amount of QB changes he expects in 2018, debating how the Championship round results will ultimately affect this exercise (32:50). Plus, Shek talks with The Athletic’s Mark Kaboly about the state of the Pittsburgh Steelers, highlighting Le’Veon Bell’s future, the coaching changes and Mike Mitchell’s reputation (1:00:25).

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: DDFP 634: Championship round picks & where does Antonio Brown rank all-time?
item.itunes:title: DDFP 634: Championship round picks & where does Antonio Brown rank all-time?
item.description:
Dave Dameshek is joined by Matt "Money" Smith, Handsome Hank and Cynthia Frelund where they react to Shek's claim that Bill Belichick is leaving the Patriots for the Giants next season (14:30) and debate whether or not an elite quarterback is still needed to win a championship (24:00). The group determines where Pittsburgh Steelers WR Antonio Brown ranks among the all-time great wide receivers (28:30) and Eddie Spaghetti hosts "Use Ya Noodle" a surprise game show highlighting the select group of QBs who have defeated Tom Brady throughout his career (51:15). Lastly, Shek and the gang make their Red Challenge flag picks for the AFC and NFC title games (1:03:45).

item.title: DDFP 632: Divisional Round Recap, Coaching Carousel & Cliff Avril
item.itunes:title: DDFP 632: Divisional Round Recap, Coaching Carousel & Cliff Avril
item.description:
Dave Dameshek is first joined by Maurice Jones-Drew to break down the Jags-Steelers divisional round matchup (2:25) and reflect on MJD’s Pittsburgh experience with his sons, both at the game and around the city (15:30). The fellas also talk about the Jags vs. Patriots AFC Championship game this weekend and Shek makes a bold prediction about Bill Belichick (1:00:48). Then, Colleen Wolfe joins the guys (43:30) for the Q&A and a recap of the NFC games, highlighting her excitement over the Eagles’ victory and the miraculous ending in Minnesota. Plus, Shek sits down with Seahawks DE Cliff Avril to discuss the future of the “Legion of Boom” and provide perspective on losing a game in dramatic fashion in response to the Saints’ loss on Sunday (32:01).

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

item.itunes:title: DDFP 631: Divisional Round picks, Willie McGinest & Lorenzo Alexander
item.description:
Dave Dameshek is first joined by Willie McGinest to break down the controversy surrounding the New England Patriots, discussing which parts of the ESPN story may have some truth behind them and which assertions he completely shuts down (3:38). Also, McGinest revisits his memorable 2003 playoffs matchup against the Tennessee Titans (22:00). Then, Shek is joined by Matt “Money” Smith, Cynthia Frelund and Bills LB Lorenzo Alexander to make their Red Challenge Flag picks for this weekend’s slate of divisional round matchups (54:07). Plus, Money reads a new batch of Eddie Spaghetti’s tweets (42:40) and the guys listen to a couple of voicemails left by relatives of Producers Kent Brown and Erica Tamposi (47:38).

item.title: DDFP 626: Playoff Matchup Predictions & Keith Cossrow from NFL Films joins the show!
item.itunes:title: DDFP 626: Playoff Matchup Predictions & Keith Cossrow from NFL Films joins the show!
item.description:
Dave Dameshek is joined by Maurice Jones-Drew and Colleen Wolfe to discuss some playoff matchup predictions, including Jaguars vs. Steelers and Eagles vs. Panthers (18:46). They also break down the confidence levels Philadelphia Eagles fans have in quarterback Nick Foles (13:23), plus Maurice discusses San Francisco 49ers QB Jimmy Garappolo's latest performance against his Jaguars (10:41). Keith Cossrow from NFL films then joins the show to discuss the latest edition of 'The Timeline' which covers the iconic 1967 NFL Championship, known as the Ice Bowl (41:08). Finally, Shek makes his plea to NFL commissioner Roger Goodell to make sure the Super Bowl matchup includes a good uniform matchup (54:55).

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.description:
Dave Dameshek is first joined by Maurice Jones-Drew to recap the contentious Week 13 matchup between the Steelers and Bengals, discussing Ryan Shazier’s injury and how players are able to stay focused after something tragic occurs (3:00). Then, Colleen Wolfe joins the fellas to talk about the Eagles’ loss to the Seahawks and provide their predictions on who in the NFC will ultimately get the No. 1 seed (23:40). Plus, in this week’s edition of the Q&A, the group talks about which team has the best home field advantage and the upcoming Eagles vs. Rams game (34:45). item.itunes:title: DDFP 619: Week 12 recap, MVP frontrunners & Brandin Cooks
item.description:
Dave Dameshek is first joined by Ike Taylor to recap the biggest storylines from Week 12 of NFL action, highlighting Antonio Brown’s impressive performance against the Packers and whether he’s an MVP candidate (5:45). Then, Shek sits down with Maurice Jones-Drew to reflect on how different the standings would be if every team was healthy (23:30). Also, Patriots WR Brandin Cooks joins the fellas and Colleen Wolfe to choose between Brady and Brees and discuss the evolution of his team’s defense this season (35:38). Plus, in this week’s edition of the Q&A, the group talks favorite TV shows and best high school memories (45:50).

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

item.title: DDFP 618: Pie Off VI
item.itunes:title: DDFP 618: Pie Off VI
item.description:
The annual Dave Dameshek Football Program Pie-Off is finally upon us! Shek is joined by an esteemed panel of Pie-Off past winners and finalists, which includes Marc Istook, Dan Hanzus, Tara Deeker and special guest Ann Bates (26:14), to taste and discuss this year's offering of sweet and savory pies. Shek then throws a "Pie Party" for a larger group of NFL Media contestants (37:26) before the blue ribbon panel of one makes the final decision on third place, second place and of course, the Pie-Off VI Piesman Trophy winner (51:58).

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

item.description:
Dave Dameshek is first joined by former NFL offensive lineman Geoff Schwartz (1:20) to discuss the best and worst o-lines in the league and the massive amount of injuries to star players this season. Then, the guys recap the latest episode of Game of Thrones and participate in another edition of "Surprise Game Show."

item.itunes:title: DDFP 590: Melvin Ingram & Tre Boston at Chargers Training Camp
item.description:
Dave Dameshek is joined by Los Angeles Chargers' outside linebacker Melvin Ingram and safety Tre Boston at their training camp facility in Costa Mesa, California. Shek asks them about the "fight for LA," if the AFC west is theirs for the taking and if Joey Bosa will have more sacks than Ingram. Plus, AM570's Beto Duran joins the show to kibitz more with Shek about the 2017 Los Angeles Chargers.

item.itunes:title: DDFP 589: State of the Dallas O-line & Will Mahomes start a game in '17?
item.description:
Dave Dameshek is joined by Cynthia Frelund and former NFL offensive lineman Geoff Schwartz to discuss Ezekiel Elliott's suspension and how his absence will affect the team this season. Then, the "10-Ft Pole" segment returns, as the fellas and Cynthia determine whether or not they believe Trubisky will start more games than Glennon, if Russell Wilson could be the 2017 MVP and if Mahomes could start a game for the Chiefs this year. Lastly, producers Sully, Spaghetti and Sideline Savy wrap up the show with their weekly Game of Thrones recap.

item.description:
Dave Dameshek is joined by Handsome Hank and CBS Sports' Will Brinson to discuss the impact of Jay Cutler signing with the Dolphins and whether or not they can still be a playoff team this year. The fellas also rank the QBs in the NFC South and name the worst rules across all professional sports. Then, Shek attempts to resolve a workplace dispute among producers Sully, Eddie Spaghetti and sideline reporter Savy, before finally turning the episode over to them, as they recap the most recent episode of Game of Thrones.

item.itunes:title: DDFP 586: Ryan Tannehill's shaky knee & Game of Game of Thrones
item.description:
Shek fought through the pain much like Ronnie Lott or Jack Youngblood have, to podcast laying flat on his back tucked in his bed. Resident Miami Dolphins fan, Handsome Hank, was kind enough to kibitz with the ailing Shek about Ryan Tannehill's balky knee and potential quarterback replacements if he did get injured. Plus, a bonus update on the DDFP Game of Game of Thrones fantasy league at the end of the show by Eddie Spaghetti, Sideline Savy and Sully. 

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

item.title: DDFP 582: Le'Veon Bell's future in Pittsburgh & Ike's Corner Corner
item.itunes:title: DDFP 582: Le'Veon Bell's future in Pittsburgh & Ike's Corner Corner
item.description:
Dave Dameshek is joined by Ike Taylor and junior welterweight boxer Regis Prograis to discuss Le'Veon Bell's contract negotiations and his future with the Steelers now that he is still without a long term deal. Ike spoke with Bell about his mindset going forward and provides his own insight into when a deal could eventually happen. Also, Shek asks Regis about the upcoming Mayweather vs. McGregor fight and how long he could last in the ring with Mike Tyson. Lastly, the fellas answer questions submitted by Vikings CB Xavier Rhodes and Jaguars CB A.J. Bouye.

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

item.title: DDFP 574: The Reality of Head Coach Firings & Finishing a Losing Season
item.itunes:title: DDFP 574: The Reality of Head Coach Firings & Finishing a Losing Season
item.description:
Dave Dameshek is joined by actor Brian Baumgartner to discuss the rise and fall of the 2016 Los Angeles Rams as depicted in Amazon's second season of All or Nothing. The guys hone in on Jeff Fisher's firing and discuss what must've been going on in the minds of the coaching staff and the players when he was fired mid-season. Also, the guys delve into the realities of how teams stay motivated during a losing season and the development of Jared Goff as we get closer to the start of his second year.

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.description:
Dave Dameshek is joined by Ross Tucker and Handsome Hank to discuss if the Patriots qualify as the NFL's "super team" and the attitude differences among the league's most popular fan bases. Then, in the "The Food Block," Shek challenges Ross to make good on a doughnut-related claim from last summer. Also, in our new segment, "Let's Be Brief" the fellas attempt to speedily answer a series of football and "game of life" questions. Plus, the guys are joined by a surprise guest who happens to have a killer Ross Tucker impression.

item.title: DDFP 568: 'Ladies Night' Frelund, Adams & Wolfe take over the DDFP!
item.itunes:title: DDFP 568: 'Ladies Night' Frelund, Adams & Wolfe take over the DDFP!
item.description:
Dave Dameshek is joined by some very talented analysts from across NFL Media, all of whom happen to be women. Kay Adams, Cynthia Frelund and Colleen Wolfe sit down with Shek to talk about the nuances of the new celebration rules and what changes they would personally implement in 2017. Also, the ladies talk about the loudest sports venues and review Dave's pick for the first Sheky category of the year, best doughnut. Lastly, Cynthia, Colleen and Kay describe how they each got to where they are today in their careers and offer advice to those who also want to work in sports.

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

item.title: DDFP 566: College All-Americans vs. Falcons & Half Empty, Half Full: Titans
item.itunes:title: DDFP 566: College All-Americans vs. Falcons & Half Empty, Half Full: Titans
item.description:
Dave Dameshek is joined by Marc Istook and Patrick Claybon to discuss the NBA Finals, their "life résumé" accolades and whether or not the 2016 College All-Americans could beat the 2016 Atlanta Falcons. Also, in another edition of "Half Empty, Half Full" the fellas talk about the positives and negatives facing the Tennessee Titans ahead of the 2017 NFL season. Plus, the guys participate in a coaching-themed surprise game show and discuss the best comedy movies of the past few decades. Lastly, Shek reads responses from members of the Shek Republic about which all-time NFL teams and players fell short of high expectations.

item.description:
Dave Dameshek is joined by Cynthia Frelund, Matt "Money" Smith and Maurice Jones-Drew to discuss the NFL teams that famously fell short of expectations in response to the latest news regarding Tiger Woods and his decline from the top. The fellas and Cynthia also preview the upcoming NBA Finals and determine if the 1989 All-NBA team would beat the 2017 squad. Then, thanks to MJD's return, the guys discuss the next season of Game of Thrones and debate the best format for this year's fantasy league. Lastly, in this edition of "Cynthesize It!" item.description:
Dave Dameshek turns it over to two of our DDFP favorites, Ike Taylor and Maurice Jones-Drew, for Vol. 1 of their best moments on the show from this past season. From the time the guys co-hosted the show in Shek's absence to their fantastic commentary during Joe Buck's visit, Ike and Maurice have clearly proven they are deserving of the "Best of" treatment. Relive MJD's emotional draft story, gain some valuable game of life advice from Dear Ikey and perhaps even indulge in some football analysis with the help of "Ike's Corner Corner."

item.description:
Dave Dameshek is joined by Handsome Hank and Cynthia Frelund to react to the latest 2017 NFL rule changes. Also, in response to the league relaxing rules on celebrations, Dave tells the story of when Adam Carolla invented an infamous touchdown "celebration" later used by Doug Baldwin for Tom Cruise and Jon Hamm. Then, in this edition of "Half Empty, Half Full" the fellas and Cynthia look at the positives and negatives facing both the Ravens and Browns. Lastly, for "Cynthesize It!" Cynthia makes the case for Matthew Stafford being better than Big Ben.

item.title: DDFP 560: '17 Seahawks w/ Cliff Avril & Rivers debate w/ Casey Hayward
item.itunes:title: DDFP 560: '17 Seahawks w/ Cliff Avril & Rivers debate w/ Casey Hayward
item.description:
Dave Dameshek is first joined by Seattle Seahawks defensive end Cliff Avril to discuss his team's dominant defense and how they plan to bounce back in 2017. Also, Shek asks Cliff about Earl Thomas being the Seahawks' "jenga piece" and gets his insider's perspective on the Richard Sherman trade rumors. Then, in response to Shek referring to Philip Rivers as a "borderline" Hall of Famer on NFL Network's Top 100 reaction show, Chargers cornerback Casey Hayward joins the show to defend his teammate. Plus, Casey weighs in on how the Chargers plan to win the AFC West this season and details his Los Angeles moving plans.

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

item.title: DDFP 559: 2017's Top 200 Players & Who should sign LeGarrette Blount?
item.itunes:title: DDFP 559: 2017's Top 200 Players & Who should sign LeGarrette Blount?
item.description:
Dave Dameshek is joined by Michael Fabiano and Cynthia Frelund to discuss Fabs' recently released list of the Top 200 Players for 2017. The fellas and Cynthia talk about the potential strategy the Raiders will utilize with the return of Marshawn Lynch, as well as the impact Eddie Lacy could have in Seattle. item.title: DDFP 557: 2017 Draft Rounds 1-7 recap & Who should pick up Jay Cutler?
item.itunes:title: DDFP 557: 2017 Draft Rounds 1-7 recap & Who should pick up Jay Cutler?
item.description:
Dave Dameshek is joined by Handsome Hank, Matt "Money" Smith and Cynthia Frelund to break down the 2017 NFL Draft, beginning with the Chicago Bears' controversial pick of Mitchell Trubisky. Also, Dave details his positive experience in Philadelphia, while also calling out Philly fans for inadvertently booing themselves during speeches from the Commissioner and Drew Pearson. Then, the fellas and Cynthia discuss the Chargers' impressive picks and commend the Browns and Jets for not reaching for QBs this year. Lastly, Money declares the Chiefs as one of his Draft losers and the guys talk about the best potential fits for Jay Cutler now that the Draft is complete.

item.itunes:title: DDFP 551: Marshawn Lynch latest & Malcolm Jenkins on OBJ vs. Marshall
item.description:
Dave Dameshek is joined by Cynthia Frelund to discuss the latest news regarding a Marshawn Lynch trade and to participate in another Producer Conference. Shek and Cynthia answer questions about Jarvis Landry's comments about sweeping the Patriots this year, the impact of analytics on the NFL Draft and Shek's recent beverage of choice. Then, Shek is joined by Malcolm Jenkins to talk about the toughest wide receivers to cover and how much of a challenge the Giants will be now that they have Brandon Marshall. Plus, Malcolm details his 2009 Draft experience, picks his winners for the first round of the NHL playoffs, and also weighs in on the Joe Mixon debate.

item.itunes:title: DDFP 548: Tony Romo's retirement, Hall or Nothing & Top 3 QB prospects
item.description:
Dave Dameshek is joined by Bucky Brooks and Elliot Harrison to discuss the news of Tony Romo's retirement and whether or not he will ultimately make it into the Pro Football Hall of Fame. The fellas also talk about the impact of Romo's retirement on the rest of the teams in need of a starter. Then, in a game of "Cutty, Kap or Draft" the guys debate what the Texans should do at the QB position this season. Plus, Shek asks Bucky, "What's up with Scouts?" in search of answers about how they missed on successful QBs like Tony Romo, Tom Brady and Kurt Warner. Lastly, Bucky gives a quick breakdown of each of his Top 3 QB prospects available in the 2017 NFL Draft.

item.title: DDFP 545: 'Mean' Joe Greene interview
item.itunes:title: DDFP 545: 'Mean' Joe Greene interview
item.description:
Dave Dameshek talks to Pittsburgh Steelers legend "Mean" Joe Greene about the dominance of the 1970's Steel Curtain and whether they were the best defense of all-time. Greene also discusses the legacy of his former coach Chuck Noll and what it was like to play for him. Shek also asks Joe about his favorite teammate and some of his memories from the 1979 season. Lastly, Greene weighs in on the 21st century New England Patriots and how they're able to maintain their excellence year after year.

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

item.title: DDFP 540: Free Agency latest: Osweiler, Jeffery, Jackson, Romo & more!
item.itunes:title: DDFP 540: Free Agency latest: Osweiler, Jeffery, Jackson, Romo & more!
item.description:
Dave Dameshek is joined by Patrick Claybon and Cynthia Frelund to react and respond to the latest free agency news from around the league. The fellas and Cynthia discuss Brock Osweiler's trade to Cleveland and what the Browns may plan to do at the quarterback position. Then, the guys react to Alshon Jeffery signing with the Eagles, as well as the impact of A.J. Bouye's trade to the Jaguars. Also, in this edition of "Cynthesize It!" Cynthia breaks down the ins and outs of free agency, including the complexities of salary cap space and setting the market value for specific positions. Lastly, everyone weighs in on where both Colin Kaepernick and Tony Romo will land.

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

item.title: DDFP 538: Malcolm Jenkins on Chip Kelly, Colin Kaepernick & the NFLPA
item.itunes:title: DDFP 538: Malcolm Jenkins on Chip Kelly, Colin Kaepernick & the NFLPA
item.description:
Dave Dameshek sits down with Philadelphia Eagles safety Malcolm Jenkins at Gatlin's BBQ in Houston, Texas to discuss if New Orleans has better food than Philadelphia, as well as Malcolm's limited experience with tailgating football games. Then, Shek asks Jenkins about his experience playing for Chip Kelly and if he believes Kelly will ultimately get the last laugh. Also, Malcolm weighs in on Colin Kaepernick's protest and how he believes athletes can effectively utilize their platforms for social and political causes. Lastly, Shek and Malcolm decide to create their own gold jackets for people they choose to be in their "Hall of Great."

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.description:
Dave Dameshek is joined by Marc Istook to discuss Jamaal Charles' release from the Chiefs and where he falls in the rankings of best all-time Chiefs running backs. Then, Patrick Claybon joins the fellas to talk about potential landing spots for Adrian Peterson, Bill Polian's comments regarding Terrell Owens and the best spots for fast food burgers. Plus, Shek debuts Claybon's intro song! Shek and Marc also revisit the "Hall of All," naming their top ten candidates across all professional sports for this honor. Lastly, in this edition of "Half Empty, Half Full" the guys discuss the positives and negatives facing the Dallas Cowboys ahead of the 2017 season.

item.title: DDFP 533: Half Empty, Half Full: Jets with Jonah Keri & Best days in life
item.itunes:title: DDFP 533: Half Empty, Half Full: Jets with Jonah Keri & Best days in life
item.description:
Dave Dameshek is joined by Handsome Hank, Matt "Money" Smith and Jonah Keri to breakdown the Jets' 2016 season and discuss the team's positives and negatives as they prepare for the 2017 season in a new edition of "Half Empty, Half Full." Also, the fellas delve into an animated debate regarding whether or not a hamburger is a sandwich and discuss the best days in life, highlighting snow days and the last day of school. Then, in an interview from Super Bowl weekend, Shek, Ike Taylor and Maurice Jones-Drew talk to Jerome Bettis about being teammates with Ike, Le'Veon Bell's transformation and competing with Ben Roethlisberger in practice.

item.title: DDFP 513: Week 13 recap, Earl Thomas' injury & Joe Buck joins the show!
item.itunes:title: DDFP 513: Week 13 recap, Earl Thomas' injury & Joe Buck joins the show!
item.description:
Shek is joined by Ike Taylor and Maurice Jones-Drew to discuss how Earl Thomas' injury will affect the Seahawks going forward and determine whether or not Cam Newton should've been benched. Also, the fellas discuss the best wins and worst losses from Week 13, highlighting the Lions' win and the Falcons' loss. Then, sportscaster Joe Buck joins the show to talk about his new book, his relationship with his father and some of the highlights of his broadcasting career. Plus, Joe Buck critiques Maurice's call of Jared Goff's first touchdown, and Maurice returns the favor by reviewing Buck's call of the David Tyree "Helmet Catch" in Super Bowl XLII.

item.title: DDFP 511: Week 12 recap & Steelers vs. Cowboys 'triplets'
item.itunes:title: DDFP 511: Week 12 recap & Steelers vs. Cowboys 'triplets'
item.description:
Shek is joined by Ike Taylor and Maurice Jones-Drew to discuss Gary Kubiak's decision to kick a 62-yard field goal in overtime, determine whether or not the Patriots are more beatable now and choose between the Steelers' and Cowboys' offensive "triplets." Also, based on Derek Carr and Jordan Reed's injuries, the guys talk about toughness in the league and their own experience with playing through injuries. Then, the fellas discuss the best wins and worst losses from Week 12, highlighting the Lions' win and the Bengals' loss.

item.title: DDFP 509: Week 12 Red Challenge Flag picks & Are the Raiders likeable?
item.itunes:title: DDFP 509: Week 12 Red Challenge Flag picks & Are the Raiders likeable?
item.description:
Due to Shek losing his voice, Ike Taylor takes over as the host of the show with Shek, his raspy voice and Cynthia Frelund as guests. They discuss whether or not the Oakland Raiders are now a likeable team and if Ray Lewis was out of line in his comments about Joe Flacco. Also, Ike reveals his Week 11 "Escape Goat" and discusses Kirk Cousins' success so far this season. Plus, the fellas and Cynthia make their picks and break down the biggest Week 12 games in this edition of Red Challenge Flag Picks.

item.title: DDFP 510: Pie-Off V
item.itunes:title: DDFP 510: Pie-Off V
item.description:
The annual Dave Dameshek Football Program Pie-Off is finally upon us! Shek is joined by an esteemed panel of Pie-Off past winners and finalists, which includes Marc Istook, Dan Hanzus, Necktie Milner, Tara Deeker and a special guest, to taste and discuss this year's offering of sweet and savory pies. Shek then throws a "Pie Party" for a larger group of NFL Media contestants before making his final decision on third place, second place and of course, the Pie-Off V Piesman Trophy winner.

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

item.title: DDFP 506: Week 10 recap, Ike's Escape Goat & 2016 Patriots with John King
item.itunes:title: DDFP 506: Week 10 recap, Ike's Escape Goat & 2016 Patriots with John King
item.description:
Shek is joined by Ike Taylor, Handsome Hank and Maurice Jones-Drew to rank the key Cowboys' pieces to success, determine who would win a Seattle vs. Dallas NFC Championship game and discuss whether or not going for two point conversions is overly aggressive. Shek also premieres "Ike's Escape Goat" where Ike singles out the Steelers' defense and explains what went wrong against Dallas. Then, the fellas discuss the best wins and worst losses from Week 10, highlighting the Chiefs' win and the Saints' loss. Plus, Shek talks with CNN's John King about the presidential election results, the best QB of all-time and the Patriots' chances of winning Super Bowl LI.

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

item.itunes:title: DDFP 496: Week 5 recap, Dak vs. Romo & Bills' offense with Tyrod Taylor
item.description:
Shek is joined by Ike Taylor and Maurice Jones-Drew to discuss who the Cowboys should start when Romo is healthy, Eli Manning and Joe Flacco's struggles and whether or not the Chargers are cursed. Then, the guys break down the best wins and worst losses from Week 5, highlighting the Falcons' win and the Panthers' loss. Also, the guys talk with Buffalo Bills QB Tyrod Taylor about his success so far this season, playing with young wide receivers and his fantastic fashion sense. Plus, the fellas play a game of "Could Dave have scored this TD?" where they take a look and decide if Dave could have completed some "easier" plays from Week 5.

item.title: DDFP 486: Packers QBs, Kaepernick protest with Chuck Todd & NFL' Final Four'
item.itunes:title: DDFP 486: Packers QBs, Kaepernick protest with Chuck Todd & NFL' Final Four'
item.description:
Shek is joined by Ike Taylor and Maurice Jones-Drew to preview the upcoming matchup between the Panthers and Broncos, discuss the Eagles' decision to start Carson Wentz and reveal their picks for the "Final Four" of the NFL Playoffs. Then, the guys play a game of "Dead or Alive" featuring the Vikings' playoff hopes and the Colts' dominance of the AFC South. Also, Shek speaks with MSNBC's Chuck Todd, moderator of "Meet the Press," about Colin Kaepernick's protest and the best Packers' quarterbacks. Plus, Chuck Todd and MJD debate who will win the Week 1 game between the Packers and the Jaguars.

item.itunes:title: DDFP 480: Preseason Wk 1 Truths & Lies and "If Wide Receivers Were Desserts"
item.description:
Shek is joined by Ike Taylor, Matt Harmon and Matt "Franchise" Franciscovich to review Week 1 of the NFL Preseason and determine what truths and lies came out of the major storylines. item.title: DDFP 475: 2016 Packers with Greg Jennings & Aaron Nagler
item.itunes:title: DDFP 475: 2016 Packers with Greg Jennings & Aaron Nagler
item.description:
Shek is joined by NFL Media's Patrick Claybon, Aaron Nagler from CheeseHeadTV.com and recently retired NFL wide receiver Greg Jennings to discuss Jets QB Ryan Fitzpatrick's contract, as well as rank Packers QBs Bart Starr, Brett Favre and Aaron Rodgers. Greg Jennings also addresses his complicated relationship with Aaron Rodgers. Then, Aaron Nagler reveals his top three concerns for the Packers in 2016 and his worst losses as a Packers fan. Plus, the guys wrap the show by reviewing the Green Bay Packers' 2016 schedule in the latest installment of "On the Record."

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

item.description:
Shek is joined by Patriots DT Terrance "Pot Roast" Knighton and Lions OL Geoff Schwartz to discuss their previous NFC East matchups and the best color of food in the latest edition of "The Food Block." Shek and Terrance also discuss the best Patriots logo and the importance of the Pat's defense in the beginning of 2016. Then, Shek is joined by Handsome Hank and Dolphins RB Jay Ajayi to talk about their expectations for the Dolphins in 2016. Finally, Englishmen Handsome Hank and Ajayi test their knowledge of the U.S. in a trivia game called "Who's More American?"

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

item.title: DDFP 468: The Great Potato Debate & Walk and Talk with Hawk
item.itunes:title: DDFP 468: The Great Potato Debate & Walk and Talk with Hawk
item.description:
Shek is joined by former offensive linemen Shaun O'Hara and Brian Baldinger to taste and debate the greatest preparations of a potato. Shek moderates the debate and of course determines the ultimate winner. Also, Shek goes on a "Walk & Talk with Hawk," where the guys discuss A.J.'s experience playing the Steelers in the 2015 playoffs, as well as playing the Seahawks in the "fail mary" game. Plus, Ike Taylor joins the show to answer another question on "Dear Ikey."

item.title: DDFP 428: What's Next For Von Miller And Peyton Manning?
item.itunes:title: DDFP 428: What's Next For Von Miller And Peyton Manning?
item.description:
Shek sits down with Handsome Hank, Ike Taylor and Maurice Jones-Drew to discuss the final game of the season, Super Bowl 50. The guys talk Von Miller, and how his huge performance propelled the Broncos to victory. They also talk Peyton Manning's performance, and his future with the Denver Broncos. Ike talks about his experience losing a Super Bowl, and the impact it had on his team. Lastly the four preview Thursday's show by discussing who they think was the best defense of all time. What is next for Peyton Manning? Is Von Miller better than J.J. Watt? Will Shek congratulate the Broncos? Find out more on DDFP.

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

item.title: DDFP 427: Super Bowl Preview & Hank's Embarrassing Stories
item.itunes:title: DDFP 427: Super Bowl Preview & Hank's Embarrassing Stories
item.description:
Shek sits down with Handsome Hank and Dan Hanzus to preview the upcoming Super Bowl 50 matchup between the Denver Broncos and the Carolina Panthers. The guys make their picks, as well as predict how Super Bowl 50 will unfold. The guys then talk about what a win would mean for both teams, and potential MVPs for both squads. Then Shek is joined by the NFLUK podcast "Inside the Huddle" for lots of fun Super Bowl talk. What will another Super Bowl win mean for Peyton Manning? Can anyone stop Carolina? Do you really know Handsome Hank? Find out more on DDFP.

item.title: DDFP 426: Super Bowl 50 Week & Hall or Nothing
item.itunes:title: DDFP 426: Super Bowl 50 Week & Hall or Nothing
item.description:
Shek sits down with Handsome Hank, Ike Taylor, and Maurice Jones-Drew to talk about Super Bowl 50 and all of the festivities going on in San Francisco. They talk about both the Broncos and the Panthers road to Super Bowl 50, and which players they think played key roles to their success.  Then Anthony Barr joins the show and talks about the Vikings loss to the Seahawks. The guys then talk Calvin Johnson's retirement, as well as his chances of entering the Hall of Fame. Will Calvin Johnson make the Hall of Fame? Where would the Broncos be without Peyton Manning? What is all that background noise? Find out more on DDFP. 

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

item.description:
Shek sits down with Ike Taylor, Maurice Jones-Drew, and Handsome Hank for a jam-packed episode. Ike and Maurice talk about Odell Beckham's suspension, as well as the future of the Carolina Panthers. Then, Hank joins the show for the Week 17 Red Challenge Flag Picks. Plus, a one on one basketball game between producer Black Tie, and Ike Taylor.  Watch the full show here: https://youtu.be/DefcACGSq7I

Shek is joined by Handsome Hank and Director Adam McKay to breakdown the world of football in Week 16. item.itunes:title: DDFP 414: Week 15 Review & All Santa Team
item.description:
Shek sits down with NFL Media's Maurice Jones-Drew and Patrick Claybon to review Week 15. The guys talk about Odell Beckham Jr. and Josh Norman's performances, as well as who is to blame for their on field drama. Shek and MJD give their final four predictions, one of which doesn't include the Carolina Panthers. Lastly, Shek releases the starters for his "All Santa Team". item.title: DDFP 404: Week 10 review & Shek's Open Letter on Cam & J.J. Watt
item.itunes:title: DDFP 404: Week 10 review & Shek's Open Letter on Cam & J.J. Watt
item.description:
Shek is joined by Handsome Hank to recap Monday Night Football, as well as address an open letter regarding the criticism of Cam Newton's touchdown dance and Andy Dalton's overreaction to J.J. Watt's controversial post-game comment. Then, Bucky Brooks and Maurice Jones-Drew join the guys to discuss the Broncos' benching of Peyton Manning, whether or not Brock Osweiler can keep the starting job and the Jaguars' big win over the Ravens. 

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

item.title: DDFP 270: Mike Singletary
item.itunes:title: DDFP 270: Mike Singletary
item.description:
Shek, Rank and Elliot Harrison welcome in Chicago Bears legendary linebacker Mike Singletary for a wide-ranging conversation about Singletary's NFL career. Topics include the peak and fall of the '80s Bears, their rivalry with Dan Marino and the Miami Dolphins and where '85 Bears' D ranks in NFL history. Plus, Singletary opens up about the Vernon Davis altercation and why he couldn't carry on as head coach of the San Francisco 49ers before fulfilling a life-long dream for Shek. It's a dream episode, indeed -- take a listen, won't you?     

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: DDFP 256: A.J. Hawk & draft recap
item.itunes:title: DDFP 256: A.J. Hawk & draft recap
item.description:
The post-draft podcast features Shek & Rank dialing up 2013 Sheky Award winner/Packers LB AJ Hawk to discuss Green Bay's first-round choice Ha Ha Clinton-Dix, fellow Ohio State LB Ryan Shazier, draftees' walkout music, and hanging with Brady Quinn in Paris. The fellas are also joined in Studio 66 by College Football 24/7 co-hosts Matt 'Money' Smith & Bucky Brooks to talk about Johnny Football, Jadeveon Clowney, which teams put themselves into playoff contention with their drafts, and more hilarious Money impressions. Plus, Shek & Rank chime in on the new Batman suit in a new segment "#this or #that?".

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

item.itunes:title: DDFP 255: Eric Decker, Daniel Jeremiah and a horse & carriage
item.description:
Shek and Rank take Studio 66 on the road in this 2014 NFL Draft podcast special live from a horse and carriage in New York. Guests include wide receiver Eric Decker who talks about joining the New York Jets, top prospects in the draft and playing with Peyton Manning and Tim Tebow. Daniel Jeremiah also jumps in for a ride to discuss the team most likely to select Johnny Manziel, what NFL front offices do during draft week and potential first-round trades. Make sure to watch the video interviews from this NFL Draft special podcast on NFL.com/Shek. 

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

item.title: DDFP 246: A.J. Hawk and Nate Newton
item.itunes:title: DDFP 246: A.J. Hawk and Nate Newton
item.description:
Shek and Elliot Harrison are joined by Green Bay Packers linebacker A.J. Hawk, where Hawk drops some surprising news that he is officiating weddings during the offseason. Hawk offers his thoughts on Julius Peppers, TV shows and who should replace David Letterman. The guys also chat with former Dallas Cowboys great Nate Newton about John Madden’s impact on his career and the chances that the 2014 Cowboys can become a contender. Finally, the boys discuss some of the best dynasties in NFL history.

item.itunes:title: DDFP 240: Free agency & 'True Detective' reaction
item.description:
Shek is joined by former New England Patriots Willie McGinest and Deion Branch to discuss the Darrelle Revis signing and the surprising underachievement of Bill Belichick's coaching disciples. Then, Handsome Hank and @NFL_ATL's Dan Hanzus break down more free agency news before discussing the "True Detective" season finale (*Spoiler Alert* from 41:33 to 1:02:30). item.title: DDFP 239: Free-agency freestyling with Nate Burleson
item.itunes:title: DDFP 239: Free-agency freestyling with Nate Burleson
item.description:
Shek & Rank chat with wide receiver Nate Burleson about his free agency options and the better wide receiver between Calvin Johnson and Randy Moss before he delivers Studio 66's first-ever freestyle rap. The guys also react to the latest NFL free agency news including DeMarcus Ware's release from the Dallas Cowboys and Blaine Gabbert's trade to the San Francisco 49ers. Lastly, they discuss the hilarious "Between Two Ferns" episode starring President Barack Obama and debate which NFL player they would rather be. It's hooey, it's applesauce and it's a must-listen. 

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

item.title: DDFP 235: Heads, tails and tales
item.itunes:title: DDFP 235: Heads, tails and tales
item.description:
Shek, Rank, Handsome Hank and Dan Hanzus put their own spin on the pregame coin toss -- picking heads or tails on a slate of important questions on and off the gridiron.  Should the Texans take Johnny Manziel or Jadeveon Clowney?  Should Jim Harbaugh be content with his situation with the San Francisco 49ers or should he jump ship to the Cleveland Browns?  Which “True Detective” investigator would you rather have on your force -- Marty or Rust?  All these questions and more, answered on the latest edition of "The Dave Dameshek Football Program."

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.itunes:title: DDFP 234: Bucs Gerald McCoy
item.description:
Shek & Rank are joined in Studio 66 by Pro Bowl defensive tackle Gerald McCoy of the Tampa Bay Buccaneers, who opens up about everything from his team's offseason plans to Peyton Manning's legacy.  Don't miss as McCoy sounds off on the importance of defense in the modern-day NFL and picks his favorite athletes off the gridiron -- including his answer to the age-old question: Kobe or LeBron?  Who is the most handsome player in the NFL?  Who are the fellas pulling for in the Olympics?  All this and more on the latest edition of the #DDFP.

item.itunes:title: DDFP 233: Packers Randall Cobb, Daniel Jeremiah
item.description:

Rushmore of current cornerbacks; and more. Daniel Jeremiah also checks in from the road to project who'll shine at the 2014 NFL Scouting Combine and what it'll take for the Browns to make a quick turnaround in 2014. Plus, producer Black Tie's "Shout Outs" makes a return.
